3D Modelling

Physical & Digital Sculpture

Three-dimensional creation spanning traditional clay sculpture to digital modeling. Each piece explores form, space, and materiality, investigating how objects occupy space and how digital tools can extend the possibilities of traditional sculpting techniques.

Modelling Techniques

The diverse approaches to creating three-dimensional forms and sculptures.

Clay Sculpture

Traditional clay modeling techniques for creating expressive three-dimensional forms.

Balsa Wood

Lightweight wood carving and construction for architectural and sculptural models.

Digital 3D

Computer-based 3D modeling using software for precise geometric and organic forms.

Wire & Metal

Sculptural work with wire armatures and metal fabrication for dynamic structural forms.

Modelling Philosophy

"Three-dimensional creation is about understanding space, form, and the relationship between positive and negative volumes - whether working with clay, wood, or digital vertices."

My approach to 3D modeling bridges traditional sculpting techniques with digital possibilities. Each piece explores how form occupies space and how different materials and tools can express different aspects of three-dimensional design, from organic curves to precise geometric structures.
